column4: Will, the dapper repository stay "stable" and not upgrade package versions? In other words, should i add any edgy sources to my list?
Will the dapper repos. still contain new packages, or will there be a new one for edgy?
it'll be fairly stable.  bug fixes and security fixes will be added, and there will be backports eventually.  for right now, there are no edgy repos
edgy won't be started on for a couple weeks yet, i hear.
okay, but if i don't change my sources i will be stuck with gnome 2.14 and the current version apps that i have now?
um, yes... gnome 2.14 is the latest, you know.  you're not really "stuck" with it.
if you really want to be on the edge, wait for edgy eft to get it's repos started and migrate to that.
yes, it know, but i would like to have the 2.15.1 whenever it's released, if you know what i mean...
hah, than wait for edgy.  you'll last a few weeks til' it's up :-P
okay, that's nice! I really love the simplicity og the ubuntu/debian package system :)
just remember, edgy will by syncing with debian sid, and it'll be rather unstable at first.
it's just that i just switched my amd64 from gentoo to ubunty, and i am used to run breakmygentoo overlays, so i miss the edge :P

But maybe it's time to settle down for some stability after all :D - ubuntu really offers a bit of everything. The only thing i miss is the ability to select which features packages should come with. Like gentoo's USE flags.
hrm, it used to be a supported migration path, but it might be easier to just reinstall
no, there's no supported path for that.
if you try to do that, i'll guarantee breakage.  but go ahead and try!  it'll be fun.
Hehe, no, it's an important production system.
to bad we don't have a spare machine for seamless migration. We really need SATA support in it soon, and that reguires 2.6 kernel.
and debian unstable is just not the same as dapper LTS.
i know.
got to go grab some coffe and start reading math, thanks for your support.
